lines.text: Can one of you boys give me a ride home?
Don't fall for it. She lives two trailers down.
So? Be real easy.

[pushing her out the door]
Go on home, Loretta. Come on. Go on, go on the party's over.
My mom never hid the fact that my dad chose his career over us. What was it she always said?
Once a carnie, always a carnie.
Mom still cries every time she sees a tilt-a-whirl or a fat lady in a tube top.
Are we on 'Cops' again?
it was still on the hanger.
[Amber is being filmed in her bedroom in her trailer. Annette is heard coughing]
That's my mom.

[from outside]
Hey, Amber, did ya get my smokes?
Oh, yah, I'll get 'em in a sec.

[walks in and sees the camera crew]
Aw, shit.
Oh, they're from Los Angeles. They wanted to see my room and film me for their movie.
Yah, well, if they ask you to take your top off, get the money first.
[she leaves the room]
And go get my smokes!
Hello Miss Sad Pants, and her friend, Serious Sally! How about a nice cool mint to help turn those frowns upside down?
Do you think a nice cool mint would help if I shoved your head up your ass?
Loretta, never have kids.
Oh, honey, God bless ya for thinking I still could.

[wearing her old pageant outfit]
And can you believe it, they still fit!
She had a big ass then, she's got a big ass now.

[Running onto the scene of her and her mom's blown up trailer home]
Mom? MOM?
Whoa, whoa, whoa... you family?
No, she's just yelling, "Mom, mom," because she has Tourettes! She's Annette's kid dipshit.

[as Annette is being driven away in an ambulance]
Mom! I'll be right behind you in the hearse!
Don't let that worry you Annette!
Why do I think Becky'll win? You're talking about the richest family in a small town. It's front page news when one of them takes a shit.
And so, dear Lord, it is with deep sadness that we turn over to you this young woman, whose dream to ride on a giant swan resulted in her death. Maybe it is your way of telling us... to buy American.
What is wrong with you?
I don't know. I just didn't wanna win like this.
You stop right there. You are a good person. Good things happen to good people.
Really?
No. It's pure bullshit, sweetie. You're lucky as hell, so you might as well enjoy it.
Okay.
Do you guys want some shots? I'm buyin'!

[holding up a pistol]
My mom gave me this 9-mil for my 13th birthday. Yeah. I'll always remember what she put on the card, "Jesus Loves Winners". That's why no matter what I do, I aim to win.
Say, you boys been to the Leemans'?
Shut it, Loretta.
If ya have, you got all the pictures of the winner you need.

[giving her hair a yank]
Shut up, Loretta.
Let's just say who should win, who deserves to win, is Amber.
Who don't you just pin a big old target on your ass?
She's the prettiest, ya know. Best damn tapper. The most smartest.
Most smartest? Oh, that's great, you're real educated. Most smartest! Get a picture of that, most smartest!
Most smartest.

[shaken after seeing her mom in the hospital]
Ummm. I'm quitting the pagent.

[grabbing and shaking Amber]
You're WHAT?
I'm quitting the...
I heard you! I was just trying to get you to change your mind. Amber, the woman clung to your tap shoes while she was flying through the air like a goddamn lawn dart!
I can sum up our entire philosophy with this glass. I can look at it and say it's half-full, which in the beauty pageant biz means "Where the hell's my waiter?"
I wish my mom was here.
You can wave Hi, Annette you hear that?
[Amber waves at the camera]
Hi, Monkey.
[Annette waves up to the TV]
I got some
[she starts laughing]
[Annette laughs again and sticks her thumb up at the TV]

Proud to be an American]
So what was the theme of the pageant last year?
Oh, that was "Buy American"
And the year before that was...?
"USA is A-OK!"
And can you remember the theme of your favorite pageant?
Can I? "Amer-I-Can!" People ask me where I get this, I don't know, it's... maybe a gift from God or somethin'.
Amber, I'm sorry, I really am, but you know the rules. All talent costumes have to be OK'd by Gladys before the pageant.
But doesn't someone taking your costume so you can't complete overrule that rule?
Amber, I'm sorry, I don't make up the rules.
Oh! This... This is bullshit!
Amber Atkins, that is not American Teen Princess language!
Good, cos this isn't an American Teen Princess Pageant! This is... This is... This is Nazi Germany!
[she storms off]

[to the camera]
Where do they get this stuff?
With one week to go before the pageant, I was finishing my outfit, rehearsing my talent, brushing up on current events, and running 18 miles a day on about 400 calories. I was ready.
Oh, my baby... Oh my God, the swan ate my baby!
[the documentary crew are filming the reigning local pageant winner, a hospitalized anorexic girl. Amber is doing her hair]

[entering with a box of chocolates]
What? Oh my God, lights, camera and me without a stitch of makeup on! What are you guys doing here?
What are you doing here?
Oh, Amber, like you're the only one who visits Mary.
Who are you?
Who are you? Oh, Mary, you kill me!
[to the camera]
She always says that, it's a little game we play, every week, same dippy little look on her face, "Who are you? Who are you?" Just like that. It's me, Becky. Mmmm, and I brought your favourites.
[she gives her the box of chocolates]
Real nice, Becky, she's anorexic.

[covering Mary's ears]
She's skinny, Amber, not deaf.

[about the town sign, which says "Home of Freda Hegstrom, Minnesota's Oldest Living Lutheran"]
Oh, yeah, sure, Freda, sure. She was the oldest living Lutheran, now she's dead as a doornail. It's the damn Shriners who won't take down the Goddamn sign, the lazy sons of bitches. Every year, every damn year, I tell 'em, "Take down the Goddamn Freda sign, you lazy sons of bitches!"
Oh yah, hell of a way to go there. After some thorough investigating we determined that the Curry girl must have been smoking and driving.
[cut to Amber working in the funeral home]

Well yah, Tammy liked to drive her dad's thresher, but I mean... I mean she said the heavy vibration helped her think. But I know for a fact Tammy only smoked AFTER a good drive. You ask me, or anyone who isn't scared to talk about it, Tammy was murdered. Oh God, I bet Diane Sawyer never had to deal with crap like this.
Oh yeah. Guys get out of Mount Rose all the time on hockey scholarships... or prison.
Oh yeah... really nervous... it's been about, 2 months. I haven't told my boyfriend yet. How did you know?
[pauses]
OH! You mean about the pageant! Yeah!
I shoved your tap shoes in my panties before I was blown out of the house. You go find the guy who cut 'em off.
American Teen Princesses do not cross their legs like streetwalkers.
[to Leslie Miller]
Excuse me, Miss Penthouse '98, put your kness together. I could drive a boat show in there.

[commercial featuring a former beauty queen turned actress]
In fact, I love St. Paul Pork Products so much, I work here now!

[looking for a parking space]
You'd think they'd have the parking lot of America to go with the Mall of America.
[Gladys parks in a handicapped parking space]
That's a $200 fine!
I told ya I would move the car if a cripple came. Now just run in the store and pick out some outfits.
Harold, are we on COPS? Are we on COPS? Are we on COPS, Harold?
Shut up, Hanky, this here's business.
[Harold gives Hank a smack on the head]
Ow! Harold, Mom said not in the head!
Well, Mom's dead, so shut your fly trap.
I will if you shut your piehole.
[Harold starts fighting with Hank]
Don't make me kick ya where the good Lord split ya!
I don't eat shellfish. Mom always says, "Don't ever eat nothin' that can carry its house around with it. Who knows the last time it's been cleaned." She should know.
[answering "If you were a tree, what kind of tree would you be?"]
I'd have good strong roots in a town like Mt. Rose, a solid Christian trunk, and long, leafy branches to provide shade for handicapped kids on a hot summer day.
And you are...
Mount Rose American Teen Princess.
Funny, you don't look dead!
Do you think that most people would say that teenage beauty pageants are a good idea?
Oh yeah, sure. I know what some of your big city, no-bra-wearing, hairy-legged women libbers might say. They might say that a pageant is old-fashioned and demeaning to the girls.
What's sick is women dressing like men.

You betcha, Iris. No, I think you boys are gonna find something a litle bit different here in Mount Rose. For one thing, we're all God-fearing folk, every last one of us. And you will not find a "back room" in our video store. No, no, that filth is better left to the sin cities.
AKA Minneapolis Saint Paul.
Fuckin' beauty queens blowing chunks everywhere. I-I've never seen anything like it before, and I live in L.A.

[being interviewed for the documentary]
I fell in love with the big apple last summer when I was visiting my brother Peter there. He followed his dream all the way to New York... Wait, this is Peter as Liza. This is him as Madonna...
[she kisses the picture]
This is Barbara.
[after the pageant, where Lisa let Amber take her place]
I hope it was worth it.
Dad, it was worth it. Amber shoulda won.
Yeah, well, I'll tell you one thing, Peter never would have pulled a shenanigan like this.
Well, you know what, Dad? You know what? Peter's gay.
[shouts]
GAY!
[she walks off]
What?
I was Mount Rose American Teen Princess 1945. We were at war with the Japs. Didn't even get to keep my damn tiara. Had to turn it in for scrap.

[at the contestant interviews]
The tard's pants are completely off

[everyone looks at Hank who is obviously spanking his monkey]
Close up shop! Close up shop!
This pageant is like a roach motel.
Girls check in but they don't check out.

[angrily, to his daughter who has come in speaking Japanese]
English! Speak English, you stupid little retard!

[crying after her tap costume disappears]
I just wanted to compete.
I can't believe this is happening. I can't believe she said...
[thinks for a moment than takes her jacket off]
Amber, here, my jacket, take it, cos you know I know I got my costume OK'd a month ago before the pageant, you can wear it! Come on, put it on, here...
Oh wow... Lisa, I don't think you should do this.
They're never gonna let you perform naked. I asked.
Shut up, you guys.
No...
Amber, I'm not gonna to win. OK? And let's be honest our family only needs one Liza and and Peter's got much better legs than me
Your parents'll kill ya.
Come on, I love 'em... And you know that they only had me cos Peter needed that kidney.
Hey! Hey! I got second runner up! I got second place!
Third.
Huh?
Third.
No, I got...
[to the camera as she runs off following Pat]
Bye!

I chose Mount Rushmore. 'Cause to live in a country where you can take an ugly old mountain and put faces on it, faces of great Americans who did so much to make our country super great. Well, that makes me Rebecca Leeman, proud to be an American.

[to Hank]
Here's your paint can. And the next time you drink window cleaner, I'm just gonna leave it in you!
[all the contestants are vomiting]

[to her lover]
Did they hear us?
Our 2nd runner-up and winner of a $50 scholarship to the Vo-Tech of her choice is Leslie Miller.
Amber, I need Stella now. The family's steaming like a cowpie in July. Said she doesn't look nothing like the picture they gave you.
Sorry, I just thought she might not want to meet her maker looking like a cheap whore.
Well, this cheap whore is that family's loving mother.
Amber!

[while working on Brett's corpse]
If it's another stray bullet to the head, I'm gonna need more caps.
You have to go home. There's some kind of emergency at the trailer park.
Relax, that's my ma's code for bring home milk and a carton of Lucky's.
No, Loretta called; there's been a fire!
So you've, uh, you've judged a lot of pageants over the years?

No, no, no way, no. Never judged a pageant before in my life. Mm-mm. No way. Never been around young girls. I mean, even if I was, I mean, why would I wanna be, y'know? I-I don't get off on that kinda thing and that's really why you're askin', right?
[pause]
Someone say somethin'?
He sells reproductions! His furniture's as fake as my orgasms!
[during the pageant interview]
Are you Amber Atkins?

[smiling]
Yes, yes I am. Thank you. Hello.

[checking his clipboard]
Name and spell all the United States in alphabetical order.
Seriously?
my mom and Diane Sawyer... Course, I hope I end up a little more like Diane Sawyer than my mom.

[with forced sobriety]
People, people - wait, wait a minute, here. Uh, while we haven't ruled out sabotage from neighboring state pageants - Iowa, Wisconsin, North Dakota...
Yeah.
Dakota.
Ohio...
That bitch from...
What?
Wisconsin.
All right, then.
The bitch.
The important thing is that we have a winner...
So, just tell us your name, and why you're signing up for the pageant.
Ok... Hi... I'm Leslie Miller... and I'm signing up 'cause... oh... I always watch the pageants on TV and my boyfriend thinks I'll win
[cuts to Leslie and her boyfriend making out]
Hi Pat. GO MUSKIES WOO!
Why? Well, ah, it's kind of like askin' why all the guys chew Copenhagen, you know? I mea - If you're 17, and you're not a total fry, it's just what you do.

[nearly runs over a priest]
Gosh darn it! Hello, Father Donegan - Sidewalks? Sidewalks?
[Iris mimes drinking - "glug, glug"]
Iris, stop it. It's not his fault, the communal wine just proves too tempting for some of them.
And that's why we Lutherans use grape Kool-Aid for the blood of Christ.
I am reaching the point where I would kill someone for the nicotine under their fingernails.
This one's for varsity soccer, I'm captain. I run track and, uh, right here, I'm the new president of the Lutheran Sisterhood Gun Club.
Look at that one there. I think that she's had a boob job.
Oh, come on. She's too young for a boob job.
They do that at birth now, what are you talking about?

[when the contestants all start throwing up]
Somebody call a doctor!
A doctor? Somebody call a priest!

[to Becky on the swan float]
Rebecca Ann Leeman, what's going... You are the one that wanted this, now get up there! I don't care if you have to ride this thing side-saddle like a horse, get up there!
It smells funny. Like gasoline.
Oh, for Christ's sake! Everything smells like that in Mexico!
My dress will reek, Mother.
You listen to me now missy, this thing cost your dad a pretty penny, so you get your ass up there! And show me some teeth!
[Becky puts on a smile]
Lovely, baby.

[Annette thinks Amber is pregnant]
Honey, honey, come talk to Mommy. I promise, whatever it is, I won't be mad.
Okay, I'm quitting the pageant.

[grabs Amber by the shirt and begins hitting her with a beer can]
What?
[to the documentary crew]
Oh, could you excuse us for a moment? Loretta, take the guys outside, please. Now, sit your skinny little ass down!
Yo, Asswipe! Quit dickin' around with the camera!
Dude, don't say ASSWIPE! Mom's got the window open!
Come On we've only 2 frickin' minutes left on this camera,
[Amber's House Explodes Behind Them]
Beautiful as a whore's ass today, huh, boys?

[referencing a pageant dress]
Your ma did want you to have this, though, since your other one got toasted an all.
Oh, my God! It's just like Diane Sawyer's!
Yah?
Oh! Of course it's not a size 10. Diane was little hippy then.
Not our girl.
Oh, no.
Stop with the friggin' Marco Polo or I'll come over there and rip your fat little heads off!

[getting a shot]
Ow! What did they have a sale on dull needles at K-Mart?
I just need one more do-over.
Amber, how do you feel?
Well, I feel like I need to take a shower.
[everyone laughs]
Honey, is this the best day of your life?
Yeah... I wish my mom was here, though.
You can wave hi, say hi to her!
Hi mom!
Hey!
[they both wave to the camera]

[sitting in her hospital room]
Hi, monkey!
I got some!

[Becky has noticed Brett gawping at Amber, who's working in the cafeteria, so she's dropped her lunch tray in the basin, splattering Amber]
Oh man... you got some lutefisk in your hair.

[cheerfully]
Then it must be Wednesday.
[cutaway to Mount Rose American Teen Princess 1945, doing her librarian job]
Lutefisk is codfish that's been salted and soaked in lye for a week or so. It's best with lots of butter.
never sneak up on the living. You never know who might have an enbalming needle or a skull saw in their hand. Mr. Larson's son learned the hard way. He's buried next to my grandpa.

[performing her cheer at the pageant]
Roll him over! Lay him flat! Pin his shoulders to the mat! Goooo Muskies! Yeah!
What makes you so sure that Becky's gonna win?
Why do I think she'll win? You're talking about-
[to Annette]
Ow, don't pinch! You're talking about the most famous family in Mount Rose. Its front page news when one of them takes a shit!
So, who gets the crown? How are you going to figure this all out?
Well, you know, we'll, uh, compare scores and, uh, figure out a winner because, I mean, we don't know who the winner is yet. I mean, I have no idea who Jean picked, or Harold... No idea.
I know who da winner is. I know who da winner - Harold! I know who da winner is!
That's it... You shut your Goddamn mouth, you shut your Goddamn mouth you Goddamn retard!
[he climbs over the table and jumps onto Hank, wrestling him to floor]

[pulling John away and pushing him into chair]
Come on! Back off, college boy, now listen...
[he pulls John's tie and it rips off - it's a clip-on]
Hanky here can't help it if he was born crazier than a shit house rat!
Well, for fuck's sake, why didn't you leave him with a sitter?
[Hank starts to cry]
Nice, John. That's real nice... You know the babysitter's dead!
